field.name: Software Security
field.description: Application security, secure coding practices, vulnerability management, and security testing.

problems.title: AI-Generated Code Quality and Security Vulnerabilities Creating Downstream Technical Debt
problems.description: As AI code generation tools become mainstream in software development, organizations face a critical challenge: approximately 50% of AI-generated code contains potential security bugs and vulnerabilities. While AI tools like GitHub Copilot and similar assistants boost initial coding speed by 25-35%, these productivity gains are often erased by downstream bottlenecks. Developers spend significant time debugging AI-generated code that is 'almost right, but not quite'â€”the top frustration cited by 66% of developers. Trust in AI accuracy has dropped from 40% to just 29% year-over-year, yet 80% of developers continue using these tools. The nondeterministic nature of large language models means code quality is unpredictable, and security flaws learned from outdated repositories are propagated into new codebases. This creates a compounding technical debt problem as AI accelerates development tenfold while spreading insecure patterns quickly across organizations.
problems.summary: AI code generation tools produce code with security vulnerabilities in approximately 50% of cases, leading to debugging overhead that erases productivity gains and eroding developer trust to just 29%.

barriers: Legacy vulnerability patterns in training data

neglectedness.fundingLevel: Growing - significant VC investment in AI security

rootCauses.description: LLMs trained on repositories containing outdated and vulnerable code patterns
Rapid adoption driven by productivity pressure without adequate security review processes
Only 37% of organizations review AI security before deployment
Developer trust in AI accuracy creates false confidence

consequences.description: Security vulnerabilities propagated at scale across codebases
Debugging AI-generated code consumes productivity gains (66% report increased debugging time)
Technical debt accumulation accelerated by volume of AI-generated code
Junior developers not building fundamental skills due to AI reliance

existingSolutions.name: AI Security Posture Management (AI-SPM)
existingSolutions.description: Tools specifically designed to monitor and secure AI-assisted development workflows

existingSolutions.name: Shift-Left Security with AI Code Review
existingSolutions.description: Embedding security scanning earlier in development pipeline to catch AI-generated vulnerabilities

existingSolutions.name: Human-in-the-Loop Code Review
existingSolutions.description: Mandatory human review of AI-generated code before merge
limitations: Only ~30% of AI suggestions accepted after review

solutionGaps.description: AI tools that can reliably verify security of AI-generated code in real-time
solutionGaps.opportunity: Meta-AI systems that validate and correct AI code output before it reaches developers

solutionGaps.description: Training data curation to exclude vulnerable code patterns
solutionGaps.opportunity: Curated, security-vetted code datasets for AI model training

solutionGaps.description: Standardized security benchmarks for AI code generation tools
solutionGaps.opportunity: Industry-wide certification and scoring system for AI coding assistants

stakeholders.description: Software developers using AI coding assistants daily
Organizations deploying AI-generated code to production
AI tool vendors building code generation products
Security teams and CISOs responsible for application security

sources.title: 2025 Stack Overflow Developer Survey
sources.relevantExcerpt: Trust in AI accuracy dropped from 40% to just 29%. The leading complaint involves AI solutions that are almost right, but not quite, cited by 45% of respondents.

sources.title: Critical Software Development Industry Challenges to Watch in 2026
sources.relevantExcerpt: Approximately 50% of AI-generated code contains potential security bugs. Security vulnerabilities: AI coding tools learn from old repositories without knowing current vulnerabilities.

sources.title: AI could truly transform software development in 2026
sources.relevantExcerpt: Only 37% review AI security before deployment. AI-generated code often has security flaws, with studies showing that almost half of the code snippets produced by five different models contain bugs that could lead to attacks.

problems.title: Low-Code/No-Code Governance Risks Threatening Enterprise Security
problems.description: The rapid democratization of software development through low-code/no-code platforms creates major governance risks that could threaten enterprise security. The low-code market is projected to reach $50 billion by 2028, but the proliferation of these tools lets non-technical users build applications without traditional oversight. Citizen developers typically have no security training or awareness, leading to security vulnerabilities, compliance gaps, and operational hazards when development capabilities extend beyond IT departments. Traditional security tools are ineffective for low-code applications due to their visual, drag-and-drop nature. Common issues include hardcoded credentials embedded in applications, organizations becoming dependent on third-party vendor security controls, and a lack of comprehensive inventory tracking of all low-code/no-code applications deployed across the enterprise.
problems.summary: Low-code market projected at $50B by 2028, but citizen developers lack security training. Traditional security tools fail to protect these applications, creating governance blind spots.

barriers: Business pressure to enable citizen developers
Traditional security tools don't work with low-code
Lack of visibility into deployed applications

neglectedness.fundingLevel: Growing - emerging security vendor focus area

rootCauses.description: Citizen developers given development capabilities without security training
Traditional security tools not designed for visual/low-code applications
Business pressure to democratize development without governance frameworks
Lack of comprehensive inventory tracking of low-code applications

consequences.description: Hardcoded credentials and sensitive data exposure
Compliance gaps with data protection regulations
Shadow IT proliferation with ungoverned applications

solutionGaps.description: Built-in security guardrails in low-code platforms themselves
solutionGaps.opportunity: Security-by-default features that prevent common vulnerabilities

solutionGaps.description: Standardized governance frameworks for citizen development
solutionGaps.opportunity: Industry best practices and certifications for low-code governance

stakeholders.description: Security teams responsible for enterprise application security
